reviews.review_msg: You don't take this class for an easy A. You really have to work for it, BUT it's totally worth it. You will learn things that will really help you in your undergrad career. She's also very understanding about deadlines and such. Very approachable.
Very nice and approachable professor,  but she is an extremely hard marker. Make use of office hours as she will proof read and edit your papers for you!

It's a hard class, specially if you're taking it straight out of highschool. Also in the english department they very rarely give out A+ so its a toughie. Prof was very helpful and liked to engage students - the seminar format is really great - and make sure you go to office hours and make any adjustmentscorrections that she suggests.

The TM is in charge of the online class. This class is quite hard I managed to get a B. But this class is no walk in the park. It's basically all assignments (writing) and 1 midterm. The marking for essays is like 4th year marking. So pretty difficult.

The course has useful material and she is good at teaching and getting the class involved. Only thing is that she is a tough marker! She is very approachable and will help you a lot, but that doesn't necessarily mean you'll get an A. Pretty much have to live and breath english to do well.

this class offers very valuable information that will help you in university to write research papers. However that said, Michele is very unclear, unorganized, extremely unfair and she never gives back positive feedback. for a first year course DO NOT expect an easy mark.

I really liked her, I actually took the course with her a few semesters ago and I still think of her. I still use some of the stuff I learned in that class, especially reading papers and writing summaries. Always keep her notes around even though I'm doing health sciences.

This class is not an easy one but it's extremely helpful if you need to learn how to write research articles. I loved the prof, you could go see her during office hours and she'll help you with the assignment before it's due so it pretty much guarantees a good grade. No final, and she tells you exactly what you'll be writing about on the midterm.

Go to class, ask questions, and go to her office hours for help (she looks over everything, which is really useful). The class is hard, but it'll help you with your writing. Our class didn't have an exam which was good, and as long as you kept up with assignments, it wasn't too hard! Just make sure to get your work checked by her first.
She is a really nice and responsible teacher. I really learnt a lot from her class. The questions are recommended during the class. If you wanna take English 199w, take her class!
Most useful class I have ever and will ever take. It paid off with an A+ on my first paper in another class this semester. Michele is VERY friendly, helpful and approachable :)

Very nice lady who is pretty helpful. Makes class seem like highschool. Way too much homework given out. Portfolio hand ins do get confusing as to what goes in, and what stays out. Work is easy, but there is TONS of it.

Such a sweetheart! The course itself it really useful, but id recommend taking it w/ Michele! She's fun and crazy. Class reminded more like highschool. A nice break from the big lectures and hard finals.
No Comments
ALWAYS LATE. easy marker. kinda flakey but easy grade in a hard class is always a plus

very very unclear on what she wants for portfolio.  but you should just put everything u have in there to show you improved over time.  Also learn a lot from her actually.  though u need to try very hard to follow wut she says.
Horribly unorganized, portfolio assignments unclear, sends emails out last minute (i.e. 6 hours before lecture).
Really odd women, boring class, bordering on crazy.  Unclear marking scheme.
No Comments

She is really nice but she cannot teach! Everything about this class is horrible! I learned absolutely nothing and even if I did nothing from this class is transferable to school or real life! Worst class in the world!

The best advice I could ever give someone is don't take this class! She is really nice but if you are not an English enthusiast than this is not the class to take. Do not let the name deceive you, it should not be an introductory class!

The class is tough, especially if you're in first year. That being said, you do learn some new things; material can be a bit tedious at times. Sawatsky is fine though, she seems interested and will help you if need be.

She is a nice enough person and does the best she can teaching the MOST BORING MATERIAL IN THE WORLD!!! If you like 3 hours of talking about genre than this is the class for you! This is by far the worst class I have take and probably ever will!

Sawatsky is the sweetest, kindest prof ever. Taught in seminar style, the course is helpful for improving both reading and writing academic work and is beneficial for both Arts and non-Arts students; there isn't an overwhelming amount of writing.  I highly recommend taking this class with Marlene!

Class itself is useless and extremely uninteresting. Sawatsky tries to make it "exciting" but the content is drastically unimportant to 99% of students taking the class so it's hard to really care. Experienced English students will have no problem getting good grades however. Lots of writing content
She was a vey good prof! She was extremely helpful and really tried to mak ea very dry subject interesting for everyone!
she's kind. but the course is totally useless

Daniel taught me a lot about rhetoric writing, and the small class size makes him more approachable during office hours. Be sure to read the criteria carefully when writing assignments because there are essential components that you must put in. Overall, it was a fun class with only writing!
Hes a great professor and gives really good feedback. His criteria isnt that specific but hes not a hard marker. This class really helped me develop my writing,

I do not understand the good reviews for Professor Dunford. He has no outlines for his assignments which means you have to scramble to figure out how to do them, and he is extremely cold when you ask for help. You cannot even easily figure out how many pages your assignments have to be without jumping through hoops. So unnecessarily difficult.

English 199 sparked an interest in English rhetoric for me. After having taken his class, not only did I feel like I learned something about writing papers, but I also had fun doing so. That being said, attendance is mandatory, and there is quite a workload. If you keep up with your weekly assignments and engage in class discussion, you'll pass!

Daniel is a great professor. I've only taken Engl 199 with him, but the course was really helpful as an intro into university writing and such. He's a fair marker and actually gives very good feedback during office hours which I highly recommend you visit. I'm not even an English major and still managed to get a great mark .
Very average prof. Tons of assignments and grading criteria is not very clear. Seminars were interesting and engaging. Not a superbly kind or approachable guy, but also not mean.

Cheerful guy. ALOT of work. really ask him what he wants before you start doing your big assignments. attendance is mandatory since its a 17 person class. material is not hard..but different and pretty technical. really improves the way you write research institute papers/essays.

Super fellow and a great professor.  Keeps you jumping a bit but ties it all together.  Fair marker and spends a lot of time to provide useful criticism to your writing.  Very witty and keeps things current.  Excellent class.  Learned loads.
Other students will say that he gives too much work. But a course cannot be good without being demanding. There are too few like him...
helpful, makes class interesting
An excellent teacher.  Funny, informative, knowledgeable with a clear interest in the subject.  Would recommend him to anyone interested in the subject

Dont take his class. He doesnt teach you anything , does not provide a clear grading scheme, always unprepared. Follow his directions on assignments, if your thoughts do not agree with his own, he will give you a bad mark. So suit his needs. Prof to Avoid

Lots of writing compared to the other eng199 classes, but it's all pretty useful stuff. She's hardcore english though, can talk about it for hours. And the textbook is DRY. Evil thing to read, but Prof. PD is very nice.

He's super intense and passionate. One of my absolute favorite professors ever. If you put decent effort into reading the material and doing the work, it's not hard to get top marks. However, it is much more difficult to do well in exam settings or final project. Overall though, he's awesome. 10/10 would recommend.

He's a cool guy and really wants to help, you can really see when he's passionate about something and his grading is really fair. You do have to put some effort into the class, but overall it was super interesting and enjoyable.
Cramer is a good and helpful prof. He marks essays hard, but one's writing skills improve significantly after taking his class. He is very approachable. Yes, a bit monotone, and loves drinking tea.
Extremely helpful, will go out of his way to help a student in need :) greatly recommended
